pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood contemptuously, as if not wanting to eat it. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.3.1: “‘I will eat almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.4: Almsfood is to be eaten respectfully.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood contemptuously, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.13: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.14: The first training rule is finished.
